posts.post_content: Ugh. Go away. The only reason this is not completely broken (har har) is that it dies to removal. But only "destroy" removal. Seriously? Come on wizards. Mythic Rare means interesting and can be built around. Not "Lets throw balance to the winds because no one will get it anyway right?" That is the logic that made black lotus and we all know how that turned out. You will get one if you really want it, it will just hurt your wallet like one of these guys coming at your face. Lastly, I feel the need to complain about the Color philosophy here. Green is the creature color. Black is sacrifice and all but this is on a creature so if it is really good it should be green! For ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) we get Leatherback Baloth, a vanilla 4/5. Shifting that to black (which ramps just as well anyways, by way of dark ritual, getting this guy out turn two) and adding one more mana gives it +1/+0, trample and "come at me bro." Why? That is so much good... Make a Viridian Obliterator 6/6 trample, hexproof and "W... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: GengilOrbios (8/6/2011 1:37:37 PM)

posts.post_content:
Dies to removal. 1/5.  
  
...yeah, I'm joking. It's incredibly powerful, and I like any step mono black takes away from the cheesy vampire mechanics. I don't think it's quite as overpowered as [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) or [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) because of its restrictive mana cost, but yeah, definitely incredible value for CMC. If it was {B}{B}{B}{B}{B}, I'd still play it.

posts.post_content:
Okay think about this, if the "drawback" said only one permanent instead, it would still be a great card.  
  
I guess they figured that ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) was a drawback? In a dual land filled mtg, its possible to easily go 2-3 colors and be able to cast this guy.  
  
Oh well, at least this guy dies to [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat). Hes got no removal resistance, and no enter the battlefield effects, so if I am holding a removal I would be much more worried if my opponent dropped a titan.
posts.html:
Okay think about this, if the "drawback" said only one permanent instead, it would still be a great card.

I guess they figured that was a drawback? In a dual land filled mtg, its possible to easily go 2-3 colors and be able to cast this guy.

Oh well, at least this guy dies to Go for the Throat. Hes got no removal resistance, and no enter the battlefield effects, so if I am holding a removal I would be much more worried if my opponent dropped a titan.

posts.post_content:
Card proposal: Jace's Mind Flayer  
![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)  
Creature -- Illusion, mythic rare  
Flash  
Whenever a source source deals damage to Jace's Mind Flayer, you may draw that many cards and that source's controller puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.  
P/T: 5/5  
  
Mythic rare = R&D can take the day off.
